title: Mobile Intensive Course on Probability Distributions and Random Variables

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Modular learning in 5–10 minute segments via smartphones, structured around case studies linked to administrative/managerial job roles.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish types of discrete probability distributions (Bernoulli, binomial) and calculate probability mass functions using real-world business cases.
Learners understand the characteristics of continuous probability distributions (uniform, normal) and interpret probability density function graphs via smartphone apps.
Learners can calculate the expected value and variance of random variables and use them to conduct business risk assessment simulations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
